description: Launched in September 2007, WorldView-1 (WV-1) is a commercial mission owned and operated by Maxar Technologies Inc., which formed following a merger of MDA (MacDonald Dettwiler and Associates) Holdings Company, and DigitalGlobe Inc., the original developers of the WorldView series. WV-1 is the successor to QuickBird-2 and aims to provide high spatial resolution imagery of the Earthâ€™s surface to defence, intelligence and commercial industries. The WorldView series consists of 4 high resolution commercial Earth imaging satellites owned by Maxar and distributed by European Space Imaging (EUSI). An environment-monitoring satellite and the world's first 50 cm resolution commercial imaging satellite. WV-1 carries a single sensor, the WorldView 60 camera (WV60), which is a high resolution optical imager. WV60 aims to provide very high resolution land imagery, which is used for precise map creation, in-depth image analysis and change detection. Imagery collected by WV-1 is also used for mapping and planning in commercial, intelligence and defence sectors internationally.

title: WorldView-1
